body.p: This guide provides information about the WaveReady Node Manager (WRNM). It covers:

ul.li: How to use the application to configure a node and related modules
How to use the application to operate and maintain WaveReady modules installed in a WaveReady shelf.

note.p: See the Release Notes for supported hardware and software configurations in the current release.

body.p: This document uses these typographic conventions:

ul.li: Bold text is used to emphasize parameters, input fields, menu options, ports and light emitting diodes (LEDs) located on WaveReady module front panels.
Italic text is used to reference titles of other publications and for emphasis.
Courier text is used to indicate paths and filenames, user input, and system output.

body.p: This document is intended for network management personnel and technicians who want to configure, manage, maintain and troubleshoot a WaveReady system.

row.entry:
WaveReady Release 4.6.6 provides support for standard 4.6.6 features described in the applicable user guides. In addition, this release introduces:
IPv6 addressing
Running on international language operating systems
New WRNM functionality
Added Node Upgrade limitations and work-around.

WaveReady Release 4.7 provides support for standard 4.7 features described in the applicable user guides. In addition, this release introduces:
WRT-781
Additional WRT-852 functionality
New Multi-Node Manager software

WaveReady Release 4.7.1 provides support for standard 4.7.1 features described in the applicable user guides. In this document, user account limitations, serial port connection limitations, and time out configuration and limitations have been documented.
Update to Time-out Behavior and User Account Limitations

WaveReady Release 4.7.4 provides support for standard 4.7.4 features described in the applicable user guides. In this document, configuring Tilt Set Point (for the WRA-217C and WRA-219C only) has been documented.
